data.title: Peter Williston Shor
data.meta_description: Seminal contributions to theoretical computer science. In particular the Shor algorithm revolutionized the theory of quantum computation by showing that quantum computers could perform integer factorization in polynomial time, i.e., exponentially faster than the best known classical factoring algorithms.
data.text:
Massachusetts Institute of Technology

Mathematician; Computer scientist; Educator

Area

Mathematical and Physical Sciences

Specialty

Computer Sciences

Elected

2011

Seminal contributions to theoretical computer science. In particular the Shor algorithm revolutionized the theory of quantum computation by showing that quantum computers could perform integer factorization in polynomial time, i.e., exponentially faster than the best known classical factoring algorithms.
